data.title: Get Carter Blu Ray ?
data.meta_description: Could someone explain this dubbing issue please ? Are we saying this BD sounds different to the previous old Uk DVD disc ? I.e it's only on the new blu ray...
data.text:
max222

Established Member

Joined

Dec 11, 2002

Messages

841

Reaction score

163

Points

146

May 2, 2014

#26

Could someone explain this dubbing issue please ? Are we saying this BD sounds different to the previous old Uk DVD disc ? I.e it's only on the new blu ray ? And why would they dub the first minute only and not other bits in the film ? Will this film be released in other countries without the dubbing I wonder ?

DICKIEDUVET

Distinguished Member

Joined

Reaction score

1,153

Points

1,204

Age

49

Location

Kidderminster

May 3, 2014

#27

It occurs in the first scene with Carter and the 2 gangster brothers. The thick cockney accents have been redubbed by US Actors imitating a London dialect. The US BD is the same, if the UK is the same too all other territories will be identical.

All northern accents have been left untouched.

#28

It occurs in the first scene with Carter and the 2 gangster brothers. The thick cockney accents have been redubbed by US Actors imitating a London dialect. The US BD is the same, if the UK is the same too all other territories will be identical.

So there screwing us over what is a British film, how would they react if we dubbed some of the deep American accents in American produced films for there distribution and world wide.

Yet they produced Dick Van Dykes and Johnny Depp's cockney accents then tell us they cant understand Cockney.

Honestly I cant understand one word Dick says in this clip jump to 23 seconds in.

#36

larger

Watched the US Blu-ray tonight. Looks magnificent. Fantastic film and My Cocaine is breath-taking.

The ADR'd/looped audio is very strange (it's there in the original UK DVD with commentary but not the default audio) and a bit silly especially as they've altered the lines quite a bit too. Hodges makes mention of this on the Blu-ray and says it's been 'corrected on the other track' -a reference to the DVD obviously so the Blu-ray's just a copy/paste of the DVD commentary.

I see the Blu-ray also has the music-only track missing.

A lazy cheap release but I'm happy with it as it looks so great.

Dianne

That's from Blu-ray.com

Going to email them [email protected] hopefully they'll swap out my US disc if not I'll be on to Amazon.com

Dear Malcom

Hope you have a nice day

I am pleased to inform you that we have now received the replacement "Get Carter" discs and I will be sending you your copy in today's post 1st class.

I would like to say sorry for the delay and long waiting.

I hope your replacement disc will be with you shortly

Have a nice afternoon

Kind regards

Good news.

I'd just like to point out my name is not "Malcom" and any suggestion hencefore thereunto will be referred to my lawyer for action.*

I got several emails off them looks like they were a bit loose with the cc'd.

*Malcolm is a lovely name if you live in the Channel Islands, maybe.
